page.title: 04HARTHILL CHURCH REPAIRS
page.content: The church is of red sandstone. The church stone was getting worn away the roof timbers were rotting and slatrs needed replacing, the lych gate was rotten, the paths were broken, all the inside woodwork needed spraying against beetles and the tower needed repairing. There was a team of men; except for the boss, a plumber and a carpenter, the men had been unemployed and Manpower Services (countryside and recreation) employs them for one year. The Church pays only for the materials, actually the owner of Bolesworth Castle gave the money in this case. The men said they quite liked the work and the boss enjoyed it very much, they had worked for four months, starting February 1985 and still had more than half to do, it was a big job and they did not always know what they would find.
